12 ParticleFilter::ParticleFilter(struct PFinitData& data)
13  : nParticles_(data.nParticles), nTargets_(data.nTargets),
14  nStatesPerRobot_(data.statesPerRobot), nRobots_(data.nRobots),
15  nSubParticleSets_(data.nTargets * STATES_PER_TARGET +
16  data.nRobots * data.statesPerRobot + 1),
17  nLandmarks_(data.nLandmarks), alpha_(data.alpha),
18  robotsUsed_(data.robotsUsed), landmarksMap_(data.landmarksMap),
19  iteration_oss(new std::ostringstream("")),
20  particles_(nSubParticleSets_, subparticles_t(data.nParticles)),
21  seed_(time(0)), initialized_(false),
22  bufLandmarkObservations_(
23  data.nRobots, std::vector<LandmarkObservation>(data.nLandmarks)),
24  bufTargetObservations_(data.nRobots), prevTime_(ros::Time::now()),
25  newTime_(ros::Time::now()), iterationTime_(ITERATION_TIME_DEFAULT),
26  weightComponents_(data.nRobots, subparticles_t(data.nParticles, 0.0)),
27  state_(data.nRobots, data.robotsUsed)
28 {
29 
30  ROS_INFO("Created particle filter with dimensions %d, %d",
31  (int)particles_.size(), (int)particles_[0].size());
32 }
33 
34 void ParticleFilter::predictTarget(uint robotNumber)
35 {
36  if (!initialized_)
37  return;
38 
39  state_.targetPredicted = true;
40 
41  *iteration_oss << "predictTarget(OMNI" << robotNumber + 1 << ") -> ";
42 
43  using namespace boost::random;
44 
45  ROS_DEBUG("OMNI%d is predicting the target state.", robotNumber + 1);
46 
47  // Random acceleration model
48  normal_distribution<> targetAcceleration(TARGET_RAND_MEAN,
49  TARGET_RAND_STDDEV);
50 
51  for (int i = 0; i < nParticles_; i++)
52  {
53  // TODO what exactly should happen to ball velocity?
54 
55  // v = a*dt
56  state_.target.vx += targetAcceleration(seed_) * iterationTime_;
57  state_.target.vy += targetAcceleration(seed_) * iterationTime_;
58  state_.target.vz += targetAcceleration(seed_) * iterationTime_;
59 
60  // x = v*dt + 0.5*a*dt^2 with a new random acceleration for each
61  // component
62 
63  particles_[O_TARGET + O_TX][i] +=
64  state_.target.vx * iterationTime_ +
65  0.5 * targetAcceleration(seed_) * pow(iterationTime_, 2);
66  particles_[O_TARGET + O_TY][i] +=
67  state_.target.vy * iterationTime_ +
68  0.5 * targetAcceleration(seed_) * pow(iterationTime_, 2);
69  particles_[O_TARGET + O_TZ][i] +=
70  state_.target.vz * iterationTime_ +
71  0.5 * targetAcceleration(seed_) * pow(iterationTime_, 2);
72 
73  }
74 }
75 
76 void ParticleFilter::fuseRobots()
77 {
78  if (!initialized_ || state_.robotsFused)
79  return;
80 
81  *iteration_oss << "fuseRobots() -> ";
82 
83  ROS_DEBUG("Fusing Robots");
84 
85  state_.robotsFused = true;
86 
87  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
88  {
89  std::vector<float> probabilities(nRobots_, 1.0);
90  std::vector<uint> landmarksUsed(nRobots_, 0);
91 
92  for (uint l = 0; l < nLandmarks_; ++l)
93  {
94  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
95  {
96  if (false == robotsUsed_[r] ||
97  false == bufLandmarkObservations_[r][l].found)
98  continue;
99 
100  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
101 
102  LandmarkObservation& m = bufLandmarkObservations_[r][l];
103 
104  // Observation in robot frame
105  Eigen::Vector2f Zrobot(m.x, m.y);
106 
107  // Transformation to global frame
108  Eigen::Rotation2Df Rrobot(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][p]);
109  Eigen::Vector2f Srobot(particles_[o_robot + O_X][p],
110  particles_[o_robot + O_Y][p]);
111  Eigen::Vector2f Zglobal = Srobot + Rrobot * Zrobot;
112 
113  // Error in observation
114  Eigen::Vector2f LM(landmarksMap_[l].x, landmarksMap_[l].y);
115 
116  Eigen::Vector2f Zglobal_err = LM - Zglobal;
117  Eigen::Vector2f Z_Zcap = Zrobot - Zglobal_err;
118 
119  ROS_DEBUG_COND(p == 0, "Error in seeing landmark %d = (%f , %f)", l,
120  Zglobal_err[O_X], Zglobal_err[O_Y]);
121  ROS_DEBUG_COND(p == 0,
122  "Landmark %d is at (%f , %f) and I see it at (%f, %f)",
123  l, LM[O_X], LM[O_Y], Zglobal[O_X], Zglobal[O_Y]);
124 
125  // The values of interest to the particle weights
126  // Note: using Eigen wasn't of particular interest here since it does
127  // not allow for transposing a non-dynamic matrix
128  float expArg = -0.5 * (Z_Zcap[0] * Z_Zcap[0] / m.covXX +
129  Z_Zcap[1] * Z_Zcap[1] / m.covYY);
130  float detValue = 1.0; // powf( (2*PI*Q[0][0]*Q[1][1]),-0.5);
131 
132  probabilities[r] *= detValue * exp(expArg);
133  landmarksUsed[r]++;
134  }
135  }
136 
137  // Update mean error vector
138  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
139  {
140  if (false == robotsUsed_[r])
141  continue;
142 
143  if (landmarksUsed[r] > 0)
144  weightComponents_[r][p] = probabilities[r];
145  }
146  }
147 
148  // Reset weights to 1.0 - later we will multiply by the various weight
149  // components
150  resetWeights(1.0);
151 
152  // Duplicate particles
153  particles_t dupParticles(particles_);
154 
155  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
156  {
157  if (false == robotsUsed_[r])
158  continue;
159 
160  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
161 
162  // Create a vector of indexes according to a descending order of the weights
163  // components of robot r
164  std::vector<uint> sorted = order_index<pdata_t>(weightComponents_[r], DESC);
165 
166  // For every particle
167  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
168  {
169  // Re-order the particle subsets of this robot
170  uint sort_index = sorted[p];
171  particles_[o_robot + O_X][p] = dupParticles[o_robot + O_X][sort_index];
172  particles_[o_robot + O_Y][p] = dupParticles[o_robot + O_Y][sort_index];
173  particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][p] =
174  dupParticles[o_robot + O_THETA][sort_index];
175 
176  // Update the particle weight (will get multiplied nRobots times and get a
177  // lower value)
178  particles_[O_WEIGHT][p] *= weightComponents_[r][sort_index];
179  }
180  }
181 
182  // Debugging
183  // for(uint p=0; p<nParticles_/5; ++p)
184  // ROS_DEBUG("pWeight[%d] = %f", p, particles_[WEIGHT_INDEX][p]);
185 
186  // Change state
187  state_.robotsFused = true;
188 
189  // If the target measurements were performed prior to this function ending,
190  // then we should call the target fusion step here
191  if (!state_.targetFused && state_.allTargetMeasurementsDone())
192  fuseTarget();
193 }
194 
195 void ParticleFilter::fuseTarget()
196 {
197  if (!initialized_ || state_.targetFused)
198  return;
199 
200  *iteration_oss << "fuseTarget() -> ";
201 
202  ROS_DEBUG("Fusing Target");
203 
204  state_.targetFused = true;
205 
206  // If ball not seen by any robot, just skip all of this
207  bool ballSeen = false;
208  for (std::vector<TargetObservation>::iterator it =
209  bufTargetObservations_.begin();
210  it != bufTargetObservations_.end(); ++it)
211  if (it->found)
212  {
213  ballSeen = true;
214  break;
215  }
216 
217  // resample and exit if ball not seen by any robot
218  if (!ballSeen)
219  {
220  *iteration_oss << "Ball not seen ";
221  return resample();
222  }
223 
224  // If program is here, at least one robot saw the ball
225 
226  // For every particle m in the particle set [1:M]
227  for (uint m = 0; m < nParticles_; ++m)
228  {
229  // Keep track of the maximum contributed weight and that particle's index
230  float maxTargetSubParticleWeight = 0.0;
231  uint mStar = 0;
232 
233  // Find the particle m* in the set [m:M] for which the weight contribution
234  // by the target subparticle to the full weight is maximum
235  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
236  {
237  std::vector<float> probabilities(nRobots_, 1.0);
238 
239  // Observations of the target by all robots
240  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
241  {
242  if (false == robotsUsed_[r] || false == bufTargetObservations_[r].found)
243  continue;
244 
245  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
246 
247  TargetObservation& obs = bufTargetObservations_[r];
248 
249  // Observation in robot frame
250  Eigen::Vector3f Zrobot(obs.x, obs.y, obs.z);
251 
252  // Transformation to global frame
253  // Affine creates a (Dim+1) * (Dim+1) matrix and sets
254  // last row to [0 0 ... 1]
255  Eigen::Transform<float, 2, Eigen::Affine> toGlobal(
256  Eigen::Rotation2Df(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA][m]));
257  Eigen::Vector3f Srobot(particles_[o_robot + O_X][m],
258  particles_[o_robot + O_Y][m], 0.0);
259  Eigen::Vector3f Zglobal = Srobot + toGlobal * Zrobot;
260 
261  // Error in observation
262  Eigen::Vector3f Target(particles_[O_TARGET + O_TX][p],
263  particles_[O_TARGET + O_TY][p],
264  particles_[O_TARGET + O_TZ][p]);
265 
266  // TODO should the Y frame be inverted?
267  Eigen::Vector3f Z_Zcap = Zrobot - (Target - Zglobal);
268 
269  // The values of interest to the particle weights
270  // Note: using Eigen wasn't of particular interest here since it does
271  // not allow for transposing a non-dynamic matrix
272 
273  // Q - diagonal matrix where the diagonal is ( covXX, covYY, 0.1 )
274  // Qinv - inverse of the diagonal matrix, consists of inverting each
275  // value in the diagonal
276 
277  float expArg = -0.5 * (Z_Zcap[0] * Z_Zcap[0] / obs.covXX +
278  Z_Zcap[1] * Z_Zcap[1] / obs.covYY +
279  Z_Zcap[2] * Z_Zcap[2] / 0.1);
280 
281  float detValue = 1.0;
282 
283  probabilities[r] *= detValue * exp(expArg);
284  }
285 
286  // Calculate total weight contributed by this particle
287  float totalWeight =
288  std::accumulate(probabilities.begin(), probabilities.end(), 0.0);
289 
290  // If the weight is the maximum as of now, update the maximum and set
291  // particle p as mStar
292  if (totalWeight > maxTargetSubParticleWeight)
293  {
294  // Swap particle m with m* so that the most relevant (in terms of
295  // weight)
296  // target subparticle is at the lowest indexes
297  maxTargetSubParticleWeight = totalWeight;
298  mStar = p;
299  }
300  }
301 
302  // Particle m* has been found, let's swap the subparticles
303  for (uint i = 0; i < STATES_PER_TARGET; ++i)
304  std::swap(particles_[O_TARGET + i][m], particles_[O_TARGET + i][mStar]);
305 
306  // Update the weight of this particle
307  particles_[O_WEIGHT][m] *= maxTargetSubParticleWeight;
308  }
309 
310  // The target subparticles are now reordered according to their weight
311  // contribution
312 
313  // All that's missing is the resampling step
314  resample();
315 }
316 
317 void ParticleFilter::low_variance_resampler(const float weightSum)
318 {
319  // Low variance resampling exactly as implemented in the book Probabilistic
320  // robotics by thrun and burgard
321 
322  subparticles_t normalizedWeights(particles_[O_WEIGHT]);
323  // Normalize the weights
324  for (uint i = 0; i < nParticles_; ++i)
325  normalizedWeights[i] = normalizedWeights[i] / weightSum;
326 
327  // Duplicate the particle set
328  particles_t duplicate(particles_);
329 
330  // Generate a random number from a gaussian N~(0; 1/nParticles)
331  pdata_t MInv = 1.0 / nParticles_;
332  boost::random::normal_distribution<> genR(0.0, MInv);
333  pdata_t r = genR(seed_);
334 
335  // c is equal to the first particle's weight
336  pdata_t c = normalizedWeights[0];
337 
338  // Particle iterators
339  uint i = 0, m;
340 
341  // Iterate over the particle set
342  for (m = 0; m < nParticles_; ++m)
343  {
344  // Generate number from the random sample
345  pdata_t u = r + m * MInv;
346 
347  // Add weight until it reaches u
348  while (u > c)
349  c += normalizedWeights[++i];
350 
351  // Check if i is off limits
352  if (i >= nParticles_)
353  break;
354 
355  // Add this particle to the set
356  for (uint s = 0; s < nSubParticleSets_; ++s)
357  particles_[s][m] = duplicate[s][i];
358  }
359 
360  ROS_DEBUG("End of low_variance_resampler()");
361 
362  ROS_WARN_COND(m != nParticles_, "The resampler didn't add the "
363  "required number of particles, from %d to "
364  "%d the set was left unchanged!",
365  m, nParticles_ - 1);
366 }
367 
368 void ParticleFilter::myResampler(const float weightSum)
369 {
370  // Implementing a very basic resampler... a particle gets selected
371  // proportional to its weight and 50% of the top particles are kept
372 
373  subparticles_t normalizedWeights(particles_[O_WEIGHT]);
374  // Normalize the weights
375  for (uint i = 0; i < nParticles_; ++i)
376  normalizedWeights[i] = normalizedWeights[i] / weightSum;
377 
378  particles_t duplicate(particles_);
379 
380  std::vector<pdata_t> cumulativeWeights(nParticles_);
381  cumulativeWeights[0] = normalizedWeights[0];
382 
383  for (int par = 1; par < nParticles_; par++)
384  {
385  cumulativeWeights[par] =
386  cumulativeWeights[par - 1] + normalizedWeights[par];
387  }
388 
389  for (int par = 0; par < nParticles_ * 0.5; par++)
390  {
391  for (int k = 0; k < nSubParticleSets_; k++)
392  {
393  particles_[k][par] = duplicate[k][par];
394  }
395  }
396 
397  for (int par = nParticles_ * 0.5; par < nParticles_; par++)
398  {
399  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> dist(0, 1);
400  float randNo = dist(seed_);
401 
402  int m = 0;
403  while (randNo > cumulativeWeights[m])
404  m++;
405 
406  for (int k = 0; k < nSubParticleSets_; k++)
407  particles_[k][par] = duplicate[k][m];
408  }
409 
410  ROS_DEBUG("End of myResampler()");
411 }
412 
413 void ParticleFilter::resample()
414 {
415  if (!initialized_ || state_.resampled)
416  return;
417 
418  state_.resampled = true;
419 
420  *iteration_oss << "resample() -> ";
421  ROS_DEBUG("Resampling");
422 
423  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
424  {
425  if (false == robotsUsed_[r])
426  continue ;
427 
428  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
429 
430  float stdX = pfuclt_aux::calc_stdDev<pdata_t>(particles_[o_robot + O_X]);
431  float stdY = pfuclt_aux::calc_stdDev<pdata_t>(particles_[o_robot + O_Y]);
432  float stdTheta =
433  pfuclt_aux::calc_stdDev<pdata_t>(particles_[o_robot + O_THETA]);
434 
435  state_.robots[r].conf = stdX + stdY + stdTheta;
436  }
437 
438  // Calc. sum of weights
439  float weightSum = std::accumulate(particles_[O_WEIGHT].begin(),
440  particles_[O_WEIGHT].end(), 0.0);
441 
442  ROS_DEBUG("WeightSum before resampling = %f", weightSum);
443 
444  printWeights("before resampling: ");
445 
446  if (weightSum < 0.001)
447  {
448  ROS_ERROR("Zero weightsum - returning without resampling");
449 
450  // Print iteration and state information
451  *iteration_oss << "FAIL!";
452  ROS_DEBUG("Iteration: %s", iteration_oss->str().c_str());
453 
454  state_.print();
455 
456  // Clear ostringstream
457  iteration_oss->str("");
458  iteration_oss->clear();
459 
460  // Start next iteration
461  nextIteration();
462 
463  // Exit
464  return;
465  }
466 
467  //low_variance_resampler(weightSum);
468  myResampler(weightSum);
469 
470  printWeights("after resampling: ");
471 
472  // Resampling done, find the current state belief
473  weightSum = std::accumulate(particles_[O_WEIGHT].begin(),
474  particles_[O_WEIGHT].end(), 0.0);
475 
476  ROS_DEBUG("WeightSum after resampling = %f", weightSum);
477 
478  // A vector of weighted means that will be calculated in the following nested
479  // loops
480  std::vector<double> weightedMeans(nStatesPerRobot_, 0);
481 
482  // Target weighted means
483  std::vector<double> targetWeightedMeans(STATES_PER_TARGET, 0);
484 
488 
489  // For each robot
490  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
491  {
492  // If the robot isn't playing, skip it
493  if( false == robotsUsed_[r])
494  continue;
495 
496  uint o_robot = r * nStatesPerRobot_;
497 
498  // ..and each particle
499  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
500  {
501  // Accumulate the state proportionally to the particle's weight
502  for (uint g = 0; g < nStatesPerRobot_; ++g)
503  {
504  weightedMeans[g] +=
505  particles_[o_robot + g][p] * particles_[O_WEIGHT][p];
506  }
507 
508  for (uint t = 0; t < STATES_PER_TARGET; ++t)
509  {
510  targetWeightedMeans[t] +=
511  particles_[O_TARGET + t][p] * particles_[O_WEIGHT][p];
512  }
513  }
514 
515  // Normalize the means
516  for (uint g = 0; g < nStatesPerRobot_; ++g)
517  weightedMeans[g] = weightedMeans[g] / weightSum;
518 
519  for (uint t = 0; t < STATES_PER_TARGET; ++t)
520  targetWeightedMeans[t] = targetWeightedMeans[t] / weightSum;
521 
522  // Save in the robot state
523  state_.robots[r].x = weightedMeans[O_X];
524  state_.robots[r].y = weightedMeans[O_Y];
525  state_.robots[r].theta = weightedMeans[O_THETA];
526 
527  // Save in the target state
528  // First the velocity, then the position
529  /*
530  state_.target.vx =
531  (state_.target.x - targetWeightedMeans[O_TX]) / iterationTime_;
532  state_.target.x = targetWeightedMeans[O_TX];
533  state_.target.vy =
534  state_.target.y - targetWeightedMeans[O_TY] / iterationTime_;
535  state_.target.y = targetWeightedMeans[O_TY];
536  state_.target.vz =
537  state_.target.z - targetWeightedMeans[O_TZ] / iterationTime_;
538  state_.target.z = targetWeightedMeans[O_TZ];
539  */
540 
541  //Velocities stay the same
542 
543  //Update position
544  state_.target.x = targetWeightedMeans[O_TX];
545  state_.target.y = targetWeightedMeans[O_TY];
546  state_.target.z = targetWeightedMeans[O_TZ];
547  }
548 
549  // Debug
550  ROS_DEBUG("PF says OMNI4 at (x,y) = [ %f, %f ]", state_.robots[3].x,
551  state_.robots[3].y);
552 
553  // Print iteration and state information
554  *iteration_oss << "DONE!";
555  ROS_DEBUG("Iteration: %s", iteration_oss->str().c_str());
556 
557  state_.print();
558 
559  // Clear ostringstream
560  iteration_oss->str("");
561  iteration_oss->clear();
562 
563  // Start next iteration
564  nextIteration();
565 }
566 
567 void ParticleFilter::printWeights(std::string pre)
568 {
569  std::ostringstream debug;
570  debug << "Weights " << pre;
571  for (uint i = 0; i < nParticles_; ++i)
572  debug << particles_[O_WEIGHT][i] << " ";
573 
574  ROS_DEBUG("%s", debug.str().c_str());
575 }

577 void ParticleFilter::assign(const pdata_t value)
578 {
579  for (int i = 0; i < nSubParticleSets_; ++i)
580  assign(value, i);
581 }
582 
583 void ParticleFilter::assign(const pdata_t value, const uint index)
584 {
585  particles_[index].assign(nParticles_, value);
586 }

588 // TODO set different values for position and orientation, targets, etc
589 // Simple version, use default values - randomize all values between [-10,10]
590 void ParticleFilter::init()
591 {
592  if (initialized_)
593  return;
594 
595  int lvalue = -10;
596  int rvalue = 10;
597 
598  std::vector<double> def((nSubParticleSets_ - 1) * 2);
599 
600  for (int i = 0; i < def.size(); i += 2)
601  {
602  def[i] = lvalue;
603  def[i + 1] = rvalue;
604  }
605 
606  // Call the custom function with these values
607  init(def);
608 }
609 
610 // Overloaded function when using custom values
611 void ParticleFilter::init(const std::vector<double> custom)
612 {
613  if (initialized_)
614  return;
615 
616  // Set flag
617  initialized_ = true;
618 
619  ROS_INFO("Initializing particle filter");
620 
621  ROS_DEBUG_COND(custom.size() != ((nSubParticleSets_ - 1) * 2),
622  "The provided vector for initilization does not have the "
623  "correct size (should have %d elements",
624  (nSubParticleSets_ - 1) * 2);
625 
626  // For all subparticle sets except the particle weights
627  for (int i = 0; i < custom.size() / 2; ++i)
628  {
629  ROS_DEBUG("Values for distribution: %.4f %.4f", custom[2 * i],
630  custom[2 * i + 1]);
631 
632  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> dist(custom[2 * i],
633  custom[2 * i + 1]);
634 
635  // Sample a value from the uniform distribution for each particle
636  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
637  particles_[i][p] = dist(seed_);
638  }
639 
640  // Particle weights init with same weight (1/nParticles)
641  resetWeights(1.0 / nParticles_);
642 
643  // Reset PF state
644  state_.reset();
645 
646  ROS_INFO("Particle filter initialized");
647 }
648 
649 void ParticleFilter::predict(const uint robotNumber, const Odometry odom)
650 {
651  if (!initialized_)
652  return;
653 
654  // Change predicted state
655  state_.predicted[robotNumber] = true;
656 
657  *iteration_oss << "predict(OMNI" << robotNumber + 1 << ") -> ";
658 
659  using namespace boost::random;
660 
661  ROS_DEBUG("Predicting for OMNI%d", robotNumber + 1);
662 
663  // Variables concerning this robot specifically
664  int robot_offset = robotNumber * nStatesPerRobot_;
665  float alpha[4] = { alpha_[robotNumber * 4 + 0], alpha_[robotNumber * 4 + 1],
666  alpha_[robotNumber * 4 + 2], alpha_[robotNumber * 4 + 3] };
667 
668  // Determining the propagation of the robot state through odometry
669  float deltaRot =
670  atan2(odom.y, odom.x) -
671  state_.robots[robotNumber]
672  .theta; // Uses the previous overall belief of orientation
673  float deltaTrans = sqrt(odom.x * odom.x + odom.y * odom.y);
674  float deltaFinalRot = odom.theta - deltaRot;
675 
676  // Create an error model based on a gaussian distribution
677  normal_distribution<> deltaRotEffective(deltaRot, alpha[0] * fabs(deltaRot) +
678  alpha[1] * deltaTrans);
679  normal_distribution<> deltaTransEffective(
680  deltaTrans,
681  alpha[2] * deltaTrans + alpha[3] * fabs(deltaRot + deltaFinalRot));
682  normal_distribution<> deltaFinalRotEffective(
683  deltaFinalRot, alpha[0] * fabs(deltaFinalRot) + alpha[1] * deltaTrans);
684 
685  for (int i = 0; i < nParticles_; i++)
686  {
687  // Rotate to final position
688  particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i] += deltaRotEffective(seed_);
689 
690  // Translate to final position
691  particles_[O_X + robot_offset][i] +=
692  deltaTransEffective(seed_) * cos(particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i]);
693  particles_[O_Y + robot_offset][i] +=
694  deltaTransEffective(seed_) * sin(particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i]);
695 
696  // Rotate to final position and normalize angle
697  particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i] = angles::normalize_angle(
698  particles_[O_THETA + robot_offset][i] + deltaFinalRotEffective(seed_));
699  }
700 
701  // If all robots have predicted, also predict the target state
702  if (state_.allPredicted() && !state_.targetPredicted)
703  predictTarget(robotNumber);
704 
705  // Start fusing if all robots have done their measurements and predictions
706  if (!state_.robotsFused && state_.allLandmarkMeasurementsDone() &&
707  state_.allPredicted())
708  fuseRobots();
709 }
710 
711 void ParticleFilter::saveAllLandmarkMeasurementsDone(const uint robotNumber)
712 {
713  if (!initialized_)
714  return;
715 
716  *iteration_oss << "allLandmarks(OMNI" << robotNumber + 1 << ") -> ";
717 
718  // Change state
719  state_.landmarkMeasurementsDone[robotNumber] = true;
720 
721  // Start fusing if all robots have done their measurements and predictions
722  if (!state_.robotsFused && state_.allLandmarkMeasurementsDone() &&
723  state_.allPredicted())
724  fuseRobots();
725 }
726 
727 void ParticleFilter::saveAllTargetMeasurementsDone(const uint robotNumber)
728 {
729  if (!initialized_)
730  return;
731 
732  // Change state
733  state_.targetMeasurementsDone[robotNumber] = true;
734 
735  *iteration_oss << "allTargets(OMNI" << robotNumber + 1 << ") -> ";
736 
737  // Start fusing if all robots have done their target measurements and the
738  // robot fusion step has been performed
739  if (!state_.targetFused && state_.robotsFused &&
740  state_.allTargetMeasurementsDone())
741  fuseTarget();
742 }
743 
744 PFPublisher::PFPublisher(struct ParticleFilter::PFinitData& data,
745  struct PublishData publishData)
746  : ParticleFilter(data), pubData(publishData)
747 {
748  // Prepare particle message
749  msg_particles_.particles.resize(nParticles_);
750  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
751  {
752  msg_particles_.particles[p].particle.resize(nSubParticleSets_);
753  }
754 
755  // Subscribe and advertise the republishing of GT data, time synced with the
756  // state publisher
757  GT_sub_ = pubData.nh.subscribe<read_omni_dataset::LRMGTData>(
758  "gtData_4robotExp", 10,
759  boost::bind(&PFPublisher::gtDataCallback, this, _1));
760 
761  syncedGTPublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<read_omni_dataset::LRMGTData>(
762  pubData.publishNamespace + "/gtData_synced_pfuclt_estimate", 1000);
763 
764  // Other publishers
765  robotStatePublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<read_omni_dataset::RobotState>(
766  pubData.publishNamespace + "/pfuclt_omni_poses", 1000);
767 
768  targetStatePublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<read_omni_dataset::BallData>(
769  pubData.publishNamespace + "/pfuclt_orangeBallState", 1000);
770 
771  particlePublisher_ = pubData.nh.advertise<pfuclt_omni_dataset::particles>(
772  pubData.publishNamespace + "/pfuclt_particles", 10);
773 
774  ROS_INFO("It's a publishing particle filter!");
775 }
776 
777 void PFPublisher::publishParticles()
778 {
779  // The eval package would rather have the particles in the format
780  // particle->subparticle instead, so we have to inverse it
781  for (uint p = 0; p < nParticles_; ++p)
782  {
783  for (uint s = 0; s < nSubParticleSets_; ++s)
784  {
785  msg_particles_.particles[p].particle[s] = particles_[s][p];
786  }
787  }
788 
789  // Send it!
790  particlePublisher_.publish(msg_particles_);
791 }
792 
793 void PFPublisher::publishRobotStates()
794 {
795  // This is pretty much copy and paste
796  for (uint r = 0; r < nRobots_; ++r)
797  {
798  ParticleFilter::State::robotState_s& pfState = state_.robots[r];
799  geometry_msgs::PoseWithCovariance& rosState = msg_state_.robotPose[r].pose;
800 
801  rosState.pose.position.x = pfState.x;
802  rosState.pose.position.y = pfState.y;
803  rosState.pose.position.z = pubData.robotHeight;
804 
805  rosState.pose.orientation.x = 0;
806  rosState.pose.orientation.y = 0;
807  rosState.pose.orientation.z = sin(pfState.theta / 2);
808  rosState.pose.orientation.w = cos(pfState.theta / 2);
809  }
810 
811  robotStatePublisher_.publish(msg_state_);
812 }
813 
814 void PFPublisher::publishTargetState()
815 {
816  msg_target_.x = state_.target.x;
817  msg_target_.y = state_.target.y;
818  msg_target_.z = state_.target.z;
819 
820  targetStatePublisher_.publish(msg_target_);
821 }
822 
823 void PFPublisher::gtDataCallback(
824  const read_omni_dataset::LRMGTData::ConstPtr& gtMsgReceived)
825 {
826  msg_GT_ = *gtMsgReceived;
827 }
828 
829 void PFPublisher::nextIteration()
830 {
831  // Time stamps using ros time
832  msg_state_.header.stamp = msg_GT_.header.stamp = msg_target_.header.stamp =
833  ros::Time::now();
834 
835  // Publish the particles first
836  publishParticles();
837 
838  // Publish robot states
839  publishRobotStates();
840 
841  // Publish target state
842  publishTargetState();
843 
844  // Publish GT data
845  syncedGTPublisher_.publish(msg_GT_);
846 
847  // Call the base class method
848  ParticleFilter::nextIteration();
849 }
850 
851 // end of namespace pfuclt_ptcls
852 }
